variants.Description in input context: C289G mutation in the RING1 domain of Parkin, leading to protein misfolding and aggregation.

Material used.Description: SK-N-SH cells were transfected with FLAG-Parkin constructs and treated with CCCP.

Readout description.Result Description: FLAG-Parkin(C289G) formed multiple large cytoplasmic and nuclear inclusions and failed to relocate to damaged mitochondria.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were carried out at least three times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type FLAG-Parkin was used as a positive control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Statistical significance analyzed using an unpaired two-sample t-test.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Wild-type Parkin relocates to damaged mitochondria and induces mitophagy.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Parkin(C289G) fails to relocate to damaged mitochondria and cannot induce mitophagy.

Material used.Description: Cells were lysed in 1% Triton X-100 in PBS containing 1% proteinase inhibitor cocktail.

Readout description.Result Description: FLAG-Parkin(C289G) was strongly aggregation-prone and a larger proportion was detergent-insoluble.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were carried out at least three times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type FLAG-Parkin was used as a positive control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Wild-type Parkin is soluble and functional.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Parkin(C289G) is detergent-insoluble and forms aggregates.
